intro: Phlebochilus pumilus, commonly known as the dwarf phlebochilus, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
